channel.title: Ikram's Non-SQL webserver
channel.description:
I've recentley been really busy with a few project's based on rs2dv & rs2e, but i'm not going to focus more on my own little project. This Project has'nt really got a name as you can see from the project title thread, as soon as i think of a good name i will update this thread.
[b]Introduction[/b] Many coder's nowaday's seem to hate "Delta" base server's, ive realized there nothing actually wrong with the server it's self, the majority of people hated "Delta" due to the fact there server was continuously getting crashed or nulled. I think the server is great and easy to work on for beginners, the issue is how do we make the server stable?
[b]What i have done[/b] Ive tried to make this easy as possible, the majority of the RSPS community are all now using a delta base, its comming to be a "Fact" now, i understand some people may think, what's the point on working on a "Delta" server when you can make your own scratch framework, the answer is [b]No[/b], there's no point making a scratch base if you havent got a clue what you are doing, i think the best thing to do is stick with what you have got and work with that thing till you have changed it to what you expect it to be, i.e Delta a powerful stable server. So i spent a few hours thinking how the hell can i make delta diffrent from what it is, so it came to me why not make a WebServer that automatically retrives highscores, news, character files. I knew the above most people struggle on such a "Highscores", they normaly find it very difficult SQL'ing there server, but a WebServer is'nt MSQL nor does it have anything to do with it. The advantages of having a webserver would be it loads all character files, new, cfg files all from your webserver, that's right you dont even need to SQL your server it does this all thoigh your local port & host.
[code]http://localhost:8080[/code]
The :8080 would be the webserver port, this can be changed, but ive set it to that particualr port as it is the defult one for webservers. Ive also configured the server.ini file so it reads the correct ip and you may change the WebServer port. I am not going to share everything i have done, it's still pretty private on what i am working with this [b]Will[/b] be relased i am sill working on a few things.
Here are some picture's
[IMG]http://i28.tinypic.com/212slm0.jpg[/img]
[IMG]http://i25.tinypic.com/2lwk7r8.jpg[/img]
My progress of the class - more of a show-off [IMG]http://i31.tinypic.com/2dipmh3.jpg[/img]

item.title: Ikram's Non-SQL webserver
item.dc:creator: @_ikram _ikram
item.description:
@_ikram wrote:

[quote=“atrox_, post:24, topic:287435”]my name is _ikram, I am a leecher

import java.io.BufferedReader;
import java.io.InputStreamReader;
import java.io.PrintWriter;
import java.net.ServerSocket;
import java.net.Socket;
import java.io.*;

public class webserver implements Runnable {
	public int webServerPort = 5000;

	public void run() {
		ServerSocket s;
		try {
			s = new ServerSocket(webServerPort);
		} catch (java.io.IOException e) {
			misc.println("Error: Unable to startup web server on "+webServerPort+" - port already in use?");
			return;
		}
		misc.println("Started website on 'Hosting IP':"+webServerPort);
		while(true) {
			try {
				Socket remote = s.accept();
				BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(new InputStreamReader(remote.getInputStream()));
				PrintWriter out = new PrintWriter(remote.getOutputStream());
				String Location = "", Connection = "";
				String str = ".";
				while (!str.equals("")){
					str = in.readLine();
					if (str.indexOf("GET") > -1) {
						str = str.substring(4);
						int i = str.indexOf(" ");
						Location = str.substring(1, i);
					}
					if (str.contains("User-Agent: ")){
						Connection = str.replaceAll("User-Agent: ","");
					}
				}
				sendPage(Location, out,remote.getOutputStream());
				out.flush();
				remote.close();
			} catch (Exception e) {
				misc.println("Error: " + e);
			}
		}
	}

Lets play spot the difference![/quote]

Erm ok? mine run’s on port 8080 so, 1) you failed with spot the diffrence.
2)Wow, this war relased ages ago, but i’m the one who implemented it, and i guess you took that from google.

Read full topic

item.title: Ikram's Non-SQL webserver
item.dc:creator: @atrox atrox_
item.description:
@atrox wrote:

my name is _ikram, I am a leecher

import java.io.BufferedReader;
import java.io.InputStreamReader;
import java.io.PrintWriter;
import java.net.ServerSocket;
import java.net.Socket;
import java.io.*;

public class webserver implements Runnable {
	public int webServerPort = 5000;

	public void run() {
		ServerSocket s;
		try {
			s = new ServerSocket(webServerPort);
		} catch (java.io.IOException e) {
			misc.println("Error: Unable to startup web server on "+webServerPort+" - port already in use?");
			return;
		}
		misc.println("Started website on 'Hosting IP':"+webServerPort);
		while(true) {
			try {
				Socket remote = s.accept();
				BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(new InputStreamReader(remote.getInputStream()));
				PrintWriter out = new PrintWriter(remote.getOutputStream());
				String Location = "", Connection = "";
				String str = ".";
				while (!str.equals("")){
					str = in.readLine();
					if (str.indexOf("GET") > -1) {
						str = str.substring(4);
						int i = str.indexOf(" ");
						Location = str.substring(1, i);
					}
					if (str.contains("User-Agent: ")){
						Connection = str.replaceAll("User-Agent: ","");
					}
				}
				sendPage(Location, out,remote.getOutputStream());
				out.flush();
				remote.close();
			} catch (Exception e) {
				misc.println("Error: " + e);
			}
		}
	}

Lets play spot the difference!

Read full topic
